rs.fon.whibo.GDT.algorithm

Class TreeState

  • java.lang.Object
    • rs.fon.whibo.GDT.algorithm.TreeState

  • public class TreeState
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class TreeState is used to capture and hold the state of the tree as it grows within the algorithm. It provides some basic metrics (numeric description) of the current tree that is being built. State of the tree is set using methods that represent events, and state information is extracted using getter methods.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TreeState()
      Instantiates a new tree state.

    • Method Detail

      • enterBranch

        public void enterBranch()
        Enter branch event. It changes the state of the tree caused when the algorithm enters into a branch to grow the subtree.

      • exitBranch

        public void exitBranch(com.rapidminer.operator.learner.tree.Tree tree)
        Exit branch event. It changes the state of the tree caused when the algorithm returns from a branch to a parent node to continue with the tree building process.
        Parameters:
        tree - Current tree

      • algorithmEnd

        public void algorithmEnd()
        Algorithm end.

      • analyseFinalTree

        public void analyseFinalTree(com.rapidminer.operator.learner.tree.Tree tree)
        Analyze final tree. Calculates averages and sums for some metrics. Should be called when tree building process completes.
        Parameters:
        tree - the final tree
